Uses of Class
rogel.io.fopl.proof.HornClause

  • Packages that use HornClause 
    Package Description
    rogel.io.fopl.proof
    Contains classes relevant to logic proofs with FOPL.
    rogel.io.fopl.proof.tree
    The classes in this package form the foundation of the logic-based reasoner, which solves the logical satisfiability problem: given a set of facts about some domain, and a query over that domain, does there exist a set of Substitutions that satisfy the query?

    • Uses of HornClause in rogel.io.fopl.proof

      Methods in rogel.io.fopl.proof that return HornClause 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HornClause RuleSet.getRule(int index)
      Returns the HornClause rule at the given index within the RuleSet.
      HornClause RuleSet.getRuleStandardizedApart(int index)
      Returns the HornClause rule at the given index within the RuleSet with its Variables standardized apart.
      Constructors in rogel.io.fopl.proof with parameters of type HornClause 
      Constructor and Description
      RuleSet(HornClause... rules)
      Constructs a RuleSet from a list of HornClauses.

    • Uses of HornClause in rogel.io.fopl.proof.tree

      Methods in rogel.io.fopl.proof.tree that return HornClause 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HornClause AbstractSolutionNode.getCurrentRule()
      Gets the HornClause that is currently being used as the goal for resolution at this node.
      HornClause AbstractSolutionNode.nextRule()
      Gets the next rule in the RuleSet, with variables standardized apart.
